author: Sarah Holder, David Fox
description: Authorities have arrested a 22-year-old in connection with Charlie Kirk’s death. On the Big Take podcast, what we know about the suspected gunman and ongoing investigation.
title: Family Members Led Police to Charlie Kirk’s Alleged Shooter

author: Laura Curtis
description: A 2021 loan document reviewed by Reuters shows Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook declared an Atlanta home she purchased as a “vacation home,” appearing to contradict the Trump administration’s claims that she committed mortgage fraud.
title: Fed’s Cook Declared Second House as Vacation Home, Reuters Says

author: Madlin Mekelburg, Joe Mathieu
description: Utah Attorney General Derek Brown said investigators are “absolutely” going to try to identify any possible collaborators in the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Kirk Shooting Probe Looking for Collaborators, Utah AG Says

author: William Horobin, Alice Gledhill
description: Fitch Ratings downgraded France, indicating the upheaval of repeated government collapse has locked the country into an enduring battle to contain a swelling debt burden.
title: France’s Debt Woes Mount as Fitch Downgrades Credit Rating

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Hadriana Lowenkron delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: After Kirk’s Killing, US Grapples With the Path Forward

author: Eric Martin
description: The US backed the Philippines in rejecting China’s plan to create a national nature reserve at Scarborough Shoal in the disputed sea that separates the two nations, calling it “destabilizing.”
title: US Rejects China’s Nature Reserve Plan in Sea Near Philippines

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The killing of prominent conservative political activist Charlie Kirk during a speaking engagement in Utah on Sept. 10 has revived attention on the use of capital punishment in the US. Utah Governor Spencer Cox said his state will pursue the death penalty against the person suspected of shooting Kirk. Investigators arrested Tyler Robinson, 22, on Sept. 12, and held him on suspicion of aggravated murder, a crime that could allow prosecutors in Utah to seek his execution. “I hope he gets the death
title: The Killing of Charlie Kirk Puts the US Death Penalty in Focus Again

author: Magdalena Del Valle, Eric Martin
description: The US will use this year’s gathering of the United Nations General Assembly to push other countries to adopt more restrictions on asylum, in keeping with President Donald Trump’s crackdown on immigration.
title: US Will Call on Other Nations to Restrict Global Asylum Rights

author: Ari Natter
description: The EPA plans to end standards that compel power plants, industrial facilities, oil refineries and other major polluters to collect and report data on their emissions.
title: Trump’s EPA to Stop Tracking Emissions From Biggest US Polluters

author: Erin Ailworth, Myles Miller
description: A man was shot and killed by a US Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer Friday during a vehicle stop in the Chicago area, after he dragged the ICE officer while attempting to flee in his car, according to authorities.
title: ICE Agents Shoot Man in Chicago Area as Officer Injured

author: Katherine Doherty
description: Exchange operator Nasdaq Inc. fired an employee over a social-media post that appeared to celebrate the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Nasdaq Fires Employee Over Social Media Post on Kirk Shooting

author: Chris Strohm
description: The US Justice Department charged two men for allegedly bilking US investors out of millions of dollars by inflating the price of US shares in a Nanjing-based company — spotlighting how the Trump administration is ratcheting up scrutiny of trading in Chinese companies on American stock exchanges.
title: DOJ Charging Two Men With Pumping Up Chinese Company’s US Shares

author: Cailley LaPara, Josh Wingrove
description: Union Pacific Corp.’s chief executive officer discussed the railroad’s proposed $72 billion acquisition of rival Norfolk Southern Corp. with President Donald Trump as the company seeks regulatory approval for the deal.
title: Trump, Union Pacific CEO Discussed $72 Billion Acquisition of Norfolk Southern

author: Modou Joof
description: Thirty-three Gambians hired to work in Spain on three-month contracts disappeared while in the country, jeopardizing a program designed to provide a legal pathway to work in Europe.
title: Spain’s Model Migration Deal at Risk as Dozens of Gambians Flee

author: Jonathan Tirone, Marton Eder
description: China must apply pressure on Russia to stop the war on Ukraine if it wants to live up to its potential as a global power and avoid being caught up in further sanctions proposed by European and US leaders, according to Austria’s foreign minister.
title: China Should Pressure Putin to Avoid New Sanctions, Austria Says

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: The Congressional Budget Office now expects higher inflation and unemployment this year and slower economic growth, after taking into account President Donald Trump’s tax law, tariffs and lower net immigration.
title: CBO Sees Lower US Growth, Higher Unemployment This Year

author: Peter Blumberg, Jamie Tarabay
description: President Donald Trump has repeatedly deployed the US military for domestic assignments. In June, he summoned the Guard and the Marines to Los Angeles — over the objections of local leaders — to subdue protests against his administration’s mass arrests of migrants. And in August, Trump called up the Guard to combat violent street crime in Washington, DC.
title: Why Trump’s Use of Military in US Is So Controversial

author: Debjit Chakraborty
description: Nepal’s president on Friday appointed former Supreme Court Chief Justice Sushila Karki as interim prime minister, the Associated Press reported, after deadly unrest toppled the Himalayan nation’s senior leadership this week.
title: Nepal’s Ex-Chief Justice Named Interim PM After Deadly Unrest

author: Gerry Smith, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Moderna Inc. shares fell after a report that Trump health officials plan to link Covid shots to the deaths of around two dozen children in a presentation to advisers to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention next week.
title: Moderna Falls as Trump Officials Tie Child Deaths to Covid Shots

author: Gerson Freitas Jr
description: Eggs were the poster child for food inflation last winter. Burgers could be the next.
title: Record High Beef Prices Remind Shoppers of Costly Egg Shortages

author: Jessica Nix
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention intends to fund a Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute study examining links between vaccines and autism — a widely debunked theory that Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has said deserves further investigation.
title: CDC Intends to Fund Investigation Into Vaccines and Autism

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump is slated to meet with Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed Bin Abdulrahman Al Thani on Friday, according to a White House official, days after an Israeli strike targeting Hamas leaders in Doha strained ties between the US and a key Middle East ally.
title: Trump to Meet Qatari PM Friday Amid Uproar Over Israeli Strike

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: The European Union and India are maximizing efforts to finalize a free trade agreement, a top minister in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s cabinet said, as the South Asian nation tries to broaden its trade relations beyond the US after being hit by tariffs.
title: European Union, India in ‘Intense’ Talks to Clinch Trade Deal

description: A Utah man has been arrested for killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk. The suspect was identified as Tyler Robinson, age 22. Tips from family members led to his capture. Utah Governor Spencer Cox and FBI Director Kash Patel spoke at a news conference Friday morning.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Charlie Kirk Killing Suspect Is Under Arrest

author: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan, Georgia Hall
description: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, said he’s willing to work with Donald Trump, even as the US president disparages him as a “communist lunatic.”
title: Mamdani Willing to Work With Trump as President Sees Him Winning

author: Ott Ummelas
description: Norway’s former Prime Minister Erna Solberg said she will resign as the head of opposition Conservatives after the party’s worst outcome in general elections in 16 years.
title: Norway Conservative Leader Solberg to Quit After Election Defeat

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chilean right-wing presidential candidate and front-runner Jose Antonio Kast on Friday defended former Brazilian head of state Jair Bolsonaro, who was sentenced to over 27 years in jail for plotting a coup.
title: Chile’s Presidential Favorite Defends Bolsonaro After Conviction

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Parliament is pressing for changes to a controversial EU-US trade deal reached this summer, raising the risk of fresh tensions just as Brussels seeks to stabilize relations strained under President Donald Trump.
title: EU Lawmakers Seek Tweaks to US Trade Deal, Risking Trump Detente

author: Fernando Travaglini
description: The Brazilian Supreme Court’s decision to convict former President Jair Bolsonaro reverberated in the US: Donald Trump called the ruling “bad for Brazil,” while Secretary of State Marco Rubio denounced the trial as a “witch hunt” and vowed to “respond accordingly.”
title: US Vows to Respond to Bolsonaro’s Conviction

author: Gresa Kraja
description: The US suspended a process to forge closer ties with Kosovo, citing action by Prime Minister Albin Kurti that has “increased tensions and instability.”
title: US Suspends Partnership Effort With Kosovo Over Premier’s Action

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump suggested his administration may pursue a racketeering investigation against George Soros or his family, accusing the Democratic megadonor of funding protests.
title: Trump Renews Threat to Investigate Soros for Funding ‘Agitation’

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio will travel to Israel starting on Saturday to reaffirm US commitment to the nation’s security and bringing Hamas-held hostages home from Gaza.
title: Rubio Will Visit Israel to Discuss Gaza War, Fight Against Hamas

author: Firat Kozok
description: Turkey’s Vice President Cevdet Yilmaz said the government will seek to raise revenue without further increasing taxes to avoid stoking inflation.
title: Turkish Vice President Rules Out Tax Hikes With Eye on Inflation

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Alberto Nardelli
description: US President Donald Trump said that his patience with Russian President Vladimir Putin was “running out fast” and threatened Moscow with new economic sanctions as efforts to broker ceasefire talks with Ukraine have faltered.
title: Trump Says Losing Patience With Putin, Eying Bank, Oil Sanctions

author: Levin Stamm
description: Switzerland appointed a well-established military careerist as the chief of its armed forces, a role that will involve resolving controversies and a string of procurement issues that marred the term of his predecessor.
title: Swiss Name New Army Chief Amid Procurement Controversies

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he plans to deploy the National Guard to Memphis in the latest escalation of his administration’s efforts to crack down on what it casts as rampant crime in Democratic-run cities.
title: Trump Sending National Guard to Memphis in Next Deployment

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jenny Leonard
description: The US will urge its allies in the Group of Seven to impose tariffs as high as 100% on China and India for their purchases of Russian oil in an effort to convince President Vladimir Putin to end his war in Ukraine.
title: US Proposes Broad G-7 Sanctions on Russian Energy to End War

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: King Felipe VI of Spain will visit China on a four-day trip in November as Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez pushes to deepen ties with Beijing.
title: Spanish King to Visit China in November in Show of Close Ties

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said a suspect in the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk was in custody on Friday after an extensive manhunt for the shooter.
title: Trump Says Suspect in Charlie Kirk’s Killing Is In Custody

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia said negotiations with Ukraine are on “pause,” less than a month after the summit meeting between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump that the US said would spur talks on a peace deal.
title: Kremlin Says Russia-Ukraine Negotiations Are on ‘Pause’

author: Andra Timu, Piotr Skolimowski
description: Russia’s increased aggression demonstrated by this week’s drone incursion into NATO airspace is making peace in Europe a distant prospect, Romania’s top diplomat said.
title: Russian Drone Breach Dims Prospects for Peace, Romania Says

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Jorge Valero, William Horobin
description: Finance ministers from the Group of Seven nations will hold a call on Friday to discuss the possibility of imposing secondary sanctions on India and China over their purchases of Russian oil, according to people familiar with the plan.
title: G-7 Finance Chiefs to Talk China, India Tariffs Over Russia Oil

author: Andrew Rosati, Travis Waldron
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court hadn’t yet handed down Jair Bolsonaro his sentence when the US promised retaliation.
title: US Pressure After Bolsonaro Trial Electrifies Brazil’s 2026 Race

author: Reina Sasaki
description: Astroscale Holdings Inc. expects satellite orders to increase under new space-defense guidelines issued by the UK and Japanese defense ministries.
title: Astroscale Sees Increase in Satellite Orders From UK, Japan

author: Travis Waldron
description: The Supreme Court has plunged the country into the unknown, with massive consequences for Latin America’s biggest economy.
title: Brazil Braces for Fallout From Historic Bolsonaro Conviction

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: The Swiss government is considering the introduction of fees to fund the Money Laundering Reporting Office, reacting to a sharply rising number of reports of suspicious activity in recent years.
title: Swiss Government Mulls Fees to Fund Anti-Money Laundering Agency

author: Emily Nicolle
description: UK trade groups urged the government to include blockchain technology in any deal on cooperation in technological innovation it signs with the US, ahead of President Donald Trump’s visit next week.
title: UK-US ‘Tech Bridge’ Should Include Blockchain, Lobby Groups Say

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: The Swiss government wants to allow more private companies to get involved in the reconstruction of Ukraine.
title: Swiss Draft Law to Allow Private Sector Help in Ukraine Rebuild

author: Mihir Mishra
description: India is set to reinforce its northeastern frontier by adding railway infrastructure to deepen access, accelerate logistics and ensure military readiness in case warming ties with neighboring China falter again.
title: India Is Said to Plan $3.4 Billion Rail Lines Near China Border

author: Tugce Ozsoy
description: Turkish stocks are on track for their longest weekly losing streak since February, with investors on edge ahead of yet another court battle over the leadership of the country’s main opposition party.
title: Turkey Investors on Edge Before Court Ruling on Opposition Party

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is asking Canada’s public service to get more for the government’s money when it buys goods and services.
title: Canada Looks to Rework IT, Supply Contracts in Search for Budget Savings

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: France’s tax on digital services, criticized by Silicon Valley and US President Donald Trump, won the backing of the nation’s constitutional judges.
title: Digital Tax Derided by Trump Is Backed by French Court

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: Why the former Dallas Fed president sees a 50 bps cut as unlikely.
title: Rob Kaplan on the Fed, AI, and How Globalization Is Happening Without the US

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk said the “drone attack” by Russia that happened earlier this week wasn’t a “mistake.”
title: Poland’s Tusk Says ‘Drone Attack’ Wasn’t A Mistake

author: Swati Gupta
description: Nepal’s protest leaders and the army have been holding talks for two days to choose an interim leader and restore order after deadly unrest toppled the Himalayan nation’s senior leadership this week.
title: Nepal Holds Talks on Interim Leadership After Deadly Unrest

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukrainian drones attacked Primorsk, home to Russia’s main oil-loading terminal on the Baltic coast, in one of the largest attacks on its enemy since the start of the war.
title: Ukrainian Drones Attack Russia’s Key Oil Port Primorsk Overnight

author: Eko Listiyorini, Eddie Spence
description: Indonesia has taken over more than 674,000 hectares of palm oil plantations and seized portions of two major nickel mines, handing the world’s top producer of both commodities a growing portfolio as it cracks down on illegal practices in the natural resources sector.
title: Indonesia Takes Over Mines and Palm Oil as Crackdown Widens

author: Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thai authorities have placed some areas of Bangkok under a rabies alert after detecting stray dogs infected with the disease.
title: Bangkok on Rabies Alert as Stray Dogs Spark Public Health Fears

author: Courtney McBride
description: The shock Israeli strike against Hamas officials in Doha, followed by Russian drones piercing the airspace of NATO ally Poland, delivered twin blows to President Donald Trump’s longtime boast that friends and foes respect the US under his leadership like never before.
title: Strikes in Qatar, Poland Shake US Influence Among Friend and Foe

author: Kirsi Heikel
description: When European leaders dashed to the White House for an urgent meeting on Ukraine last month, a surprise participant was present alongside the heads of the region’s four heavyweight nations, the European Commission and NATO.
title: Golf and Diplomacy: How Alexander Stubb Won a Seat at Trump’s Table

author: Milda Seputyte, Aaron Eglitis, Maciej Martewicz
description: Russia led a mobilization of some 200,000 troops four years ago as part of wargames with its ally Belarus. Months later, President Vladimir Putin ordered his troops to invade Ukraine.
title: Russian Wargames Feed NATO Anxiety After Poland Drone Incursion

author: Philip Heijmans, Eric Martin
description: The US and India are close to resolving differences over a trade deal, President Donald Trump’s pick for ambassador said Thursday, while reiterating demands that New Delhi stop buying Russian oil.
title: US, India ‘Not Far Apart’ on Trade Deal, Trump’s Envoy Pick Says

author: Swati Pandey
description: The world is shifting from a period of post-Cold War stability and integration to one where rising geopolitical risks and strategic rivalry are forcing governments and companies to build costly safeguards, a senior official at the Reserve Bank of Australia said Friday.
title: RBA Warns Geopolitical Upheaval Shows ‘Peace Dividend Is Over’

author: Lucille Liu, Martin Ritchie
description: China urged Mexico to “think twice” before levying tariffs, a warning that could signal Beijing’s willingness to retaliate over a move it sees as giving into demands from the US.
title: China Gives Mexico Stiff Warning Over Tariffs Seen Appeasing US

author: Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen
description: Vietnam has confirmed that a cyberattack on the National Credit Information Center could have led to a major breach of personal data and has warned the public to be on alert, according to a post on the government website.
title: Vietnam Says National Credit Center Hacked, Warns of Data Theft

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte’s lawyer has asked the International Criminal Court to indefinitely suspend all legal proceedings against him, citing his deteriorating health.
title: Duterte Asks ICC to Halt Proceedings Indefinitely on Poor Health

author: Swati Pandey
description: Political violence in a polarized US is surging, with the past five years of assassinations and attempts on the lives of politicians the highest on records dating back to the 1960s, a Bloomberg Geo-Economic analysis shows.
title: US Political Violence Surges to Record, Bloomberg Analysis Shows

author: Philip Glamann
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent plans to meet with Vice Premier He Lifeng in Madrid to discuss trade, economic and national security issues, Reuters reported, another sign that talks between the two sides are heating up.
title: Bessent, China Trade Negotiator to Meet in Madrid, Reuters Says

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Hundreds of South Korean workers detained in a US immigration sweep last week are returning home on a chartered plane, an episode that has stirred doubts over Korean investment and strained ties between the two allies.
title: South Korean Charter Plane Departs US to Bring Workers Back Home
